meanings.definition: To smile in an irritatingly smug, conceited, or silly way.
meanings.sent1: She always smirks when she thinks she's right.
meanings.sent2: He smirks whenever he gets away with something.
meanings.sent3: His constant smirking during the game annoyed his teammates.
meanings.sent4: The cat smirks as it knocks over the vase, knowing it will get attention.
meanings.sent5: The villain's smirking face revealed his evil intentions.

meanings.definition: A smug, conceited, or silly smile.
meanings.sent1: Her smirks after winning the competition were unbearable.
meanings.sent2: The teacher noticed his students' smirks during the test.
meanings.sent3: The painting of the clown had a creepy smirk on its face.
meanings.sent4: The old photograph captured a mysterious smirk on the man's face.
meanings.sent5: The comedian's smirk added charm to his jokes.
